description.narrative: Capacities and systems at national and sub-national levels related to maternal, newborn, and child health outcomes are strengthened, data driven and relevant for improved policy, programmes, dialogue, advocacy,which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access and increased utilization of quality and equity focused MNCH and immunization services for mothers, new born, U5 children and adolescent girls in most deprived provinces and areas

sector.narrative: Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

related-activity.ref: 0060/A0/07/881 EQUITABLE DELIVERY OF MCH AND IMMUNIZATI

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacities and systems at national and sub-national levels related to maternal, newborn, and child health outcomes are strengthened, data driven and relevant for improved policy, programmes, dialogue, advocacy

description.narrative: By July 2020, UNICEF supported in generating state-of-the-art evidence and information that guided equitable delivery of Maternal, Newborn, Child and Adolescent health (RMNCAH) services and monitoring progress through RMNCAH scorecards. These were completed through Every New-born Action Plan (ENAP) Bottleneck Analysis, MHT and CHW assessments in hard-to-reach areas. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020

title.narrative: The national MIS produces quaterly reports / dashboards on performance against key indicators for all districts within a month
An analysis of sex-disaggregated infant and child mortality estimates is produced
Existence of an EPI communication strategy
